meanings.sent1: The splotched cat had patches of different colors on its fur.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a splotched palette to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent3: The splotched clown made everyone laugh with his colorful outfit.
meanings.sent4: The splotched sky at sunset resembled a painting by a master artist.
meanings.sent5: Her splotched dress stood out in the crowd, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To mark or spot with splotches.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally splotched paint on the canvas while working on her art project.
meanings.sent2: The rain splotched the sidewalk with dark spots.
meanings.sent3: He splotched ketchup on his shirt during lunch, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: The mudslinging campaign splotched his reputation in the eyes of the public.
meanings.sent5: The ink splotched on the paper, creating an abstract design.
